com.ibm.team.scm.client

Interface IWorkspaceConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IConnection, IEventSource, IFlowNodeConnection

    public interface IWorkspaceConnection
extends IFlowNodeConnection
    Interface for allowing a client to carry on an extended interaction with a workspace stored in a repository.
    Since:
    0.6 (RTC 1.0)
    See Also:
    for general information.

    • Method Detail

      • activeChangeSets

        java.util.List activeChangeSets()
        Returns the list of active change sets associated with the workspace.

        The active change sets are considered as owned by the workspace; the access rights to modify active change sets are dictated by the client's access rights to the owning workspace.

        Note that the active change sets are also included in the change histories (after the closed change sets).

        Returns:
        the (possibly empty) list of active change sets (element type: IChangeSetHandle); the list is immutable; never null
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • activeChangeSets

        java.util.List activeChangeSets(IComponentHandle component)
        Returns the list of active change sets associated with the specified component in the workspace.

        The active change sets are considered as owned by the workspace; the access rights to modify active change sets are dictated by the client's access rights to the owning workspace.

        Note that the active change sets are also included in the change histories (after the closed change sets).

        Parameters:
        component - the component which is to be associated to the active change sets.
        Returns:
        the (possibly empty) list of active change sets (element type: IChangeSetHandle); the list is immutable; never null
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • configurationOpFactory

        IWorkspaceConnection.IConfigurationOpFactory configurationOpFactory()
        Returns the factory for creating configuration operations.

        Note that neither the factory nor the configuration operation object they create are specific to this repository or workspace connection; one factory is as good as any other.

        The repository need not be logged in.

        Returns:
        a configuration operation factory; never null
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)
        See Also:
        #commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection)

      • createChangeSet

        IChangeSetHandle createChangeSet(IComponentHandle component,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Creates a new active change set for recording changes made in the workspace to the given component.

        A typical workspace would have one active change set on the go at a time, although multiple change sets are certainly possible, either for different components or for the same component.

        Note that the change set is persisted in the repository immediately and associated with the workspace. The result contains the full current state of the new change set item. The active change set gets created in the same repository as the workspace.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The given component is known to this workspace.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        component - the component to associate the new change set with; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a new active change set; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • createChangeSet

        IChangeSetHandle createChangeSet(IComponentHandle component,
                               java.lang.String comment,
                               boolean setCurrent,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Creates a new active change set for recording changes made in the workspace to the given component, and optionally sets the new change set as current for its component.

        A typical workspace would have one active change set on the go at a time, although multiple change sets are certainly possible, either for different components or for the same component.

        Note that the change set is persisted in the repository immediately and associated with the workspace. If setCurrent is true, the fact that the change set is current is also persisted. The result contains the full current state of the new change set item. The active change set gets created in the same repository as the workspace.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The given component is known to this workspace.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        component - the component to associate the new change set with; must not be null
        comment - a comment for the new change set; must not be null
        setCurrent - true to set the new change set as current for the given component in the workspace; false to just create the change set without making it current
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a new active change set; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • closeChangeSets

        void closeChangeSets(java.util.Collection changeSets,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Closes a group of possibly-related active change sets associated in the workspace.

        Explicitly closing a change set prior to delivering it to the parent workspace is not recommended since it makes it more difficult to adjust the undelivered change set in the face of additional incoming changes from the parent. One case where this operation is useful: multiple active change sets CS1 and CS2, with file A.txt modified in CS1; in order to make a change to A.txt in CS2 as well, it's necessary to close out CS1 first; that's the only way CS2 can build upon CS1.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The given change sets is among this workspace's set of active change sets or active in the suspended set of the workspace.
          • .
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Note that the modifications to the change sets are persisted in the repository immediately.

        Parameters:
        changeSets - a collection of active change sets belonging to the workspace (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        CompletedChangeSetException - if any of the given change sets is not active for this workspace
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)
        See Also:
        activeChangeSets(), suspendedChangeSets(), ensureClosed(Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • ensureClosed

        void ensureClosed(java.util.Collection changeSets,
                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Closes a group of possibly-related active change sets associated in the workspace.

        Whether or not the change sets are actually active is not checked.

        Explicitly closing a change set prior to delivering it to the parent workspace is not recommended since it makes it more difficult to adjust the undelivered change set in the face of additional incoming changes from the parent. One case where this operation is useful: multiple active change sets CS1 and CS2, with file A.txt modified in CS1; in order to make a change to A.txt in CS2 as well, it's necessary to close out CS1 first; that's the only way CS2 can build upon CS1.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Note that the modifications to the change sets are persisted in the repository immediately.

        Parameters:
        changeSets - a collection of active change sets belonging to the workspace (element type: IChangeSetHandle) or the suspended list; must not contain duplicates; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        CompletedChangeSetException - if the given change set is not active for this workspace
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)
        See Also:
        activeChangeSets(), suspendedChangeSets(), closeChangeSets(Collection, IProgressMonitor)

      • moveFoldersBetweenComponents

        IUpdateReport moveFoldersBetweenComponents(IComponentHandle sourceComponent,
                                         IComponentHandle targetComponent,
                                         IFolderHandle[] foldersToMove,
                                         IFolderHandle[] parentsToMoveInto,
                                         java.lang.String sourceComment,
                                         java.lang.String targetComment,
                                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Take an array of folders in the workspace that are currently part of one component, and move them to another component without disrupting the histories of any of the items involved. This will create a change set in each of the source and target components for the changes involved in moving the folder. As a direct implication of this, there can be no changes on transitively contained in the folder to be moved that are included in active change sets. The folder and its contents will be removed from the source component, and added to the target folder of the target component, under the same name that they had in their parents in the source folder.
        Parameters:
        sourceComponent - the component where the folders reside before the move operation
        targetComponent - the component that the folders should be moved to.
        foldersToMove - an array of folder handles for the folders which should be moved.
        parentsToMoveInto - an array of folder handles which represent the new parents in the target component for the associated folder to be moved. This array cannot be null, and must be of equal length as the foldersToMove array. This array may contain null elements; if the element is null, it means that the client wishes to move the associated folder into the root folder of the component.
        sourceComment - a comment to add to the change set produced in the source component
        targetComment - a comment to add to the change set produced in the target component
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report describing the changes.
        Throws:
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection, or the components do not exist in the repository
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • moveVersionablesBetweenComponents

        IUpdateReport moveVersionablesBetweenComponents(IComponentHandle sourceComponent,
                                              IComponentHandle targetComponent,
                                              IVersionableHandle[] versionablesToMove,
                                              IFolderHandle[] parentsToMoveInto,
                                              java.lang.String sourceComment,
                                              java.lang.String targetComment,
                                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Take an array of versionables in the workspace that are currently part of one component, and move them to another component without disrupting the histories of any of the items involved. This will create a change set in each of the source and target components for the changes involved in moving the folder. As a direct implication of this, there can be no changes on transitively contained in any versionables to be moved that are included in active change sets. The versionables and their children will be removed from the source component, and added to the target folder of the target component, under the same name that they had in their parents in the source folder.
        Parameters:
        sourceComponent - the component where the folders reside before the move operation
        targetComponent - the component that the folders should be moved to.
        versionablesToMove - an array of versionable handles for the versionables which should be moved.
        parentsToMoveInto - an array of folder handles which represent the new parents in the target component for the associated folder to be moved. This array cannot be null, and must be of equal length as the foldersToMove array. This array may contain null elements; if the element is null, it means that the client wishes to move the associated folder into the root folder of the component.
        sourceComment - a comment to add to the change set produced in the source component
        targetComment - a comment to add to the change set produced in the target component
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report describing the changes.
        Throws:
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection, or the components do not exist in the repository
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.11.0.2 (RTC 6.0.2)

      • accept

        IUpdateReport accept(int flags,
                   IWorkspaceConnection acceptSource,
                   IChangeHistorySyncReport syncReport,
                   java.util.List baselines,
                   java.util.List incomingChangeSets,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Accepts into the workspace the given baselines (one per component) and additional incoming change sets.

        The baseline (if any) for each component becomes the new basis for the component in the workspace, and the list of additional incoming change sets is also accepted into the workspace, effectively defining the configuration of each component in the workspace by incorporating the changes described by both the baseline and the additional change sets. Any change sets that were in the workspace's change history but not in the incoming baseline or incoming change sets are also preserved. If no baseline is specified for a component, the workspace's basis for that component remains unchanged and the list of change sets for that component is accepted into the workspace and applied to the workspace's existing basis for that component in order to define the configuration.

        The change history sync report passed is the foundation for the accept operation. The local change histories of the sync report are this workspace's; the remote change histories of the sync report are the source of the accept operation.

        The operation fails if an incoming change set (or one of those to preserve) affects an item in a way that cannot be squared with the change history; for example, a "gap" can occur if an attempt is made to accept an incoming change set without a change set on which it depends. The operation is atomic; if it fails, it fails atomically.

        The preconditions of this operation are:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The sync report is applicable; i.e., the remote workspace is unchanged since the sync report was obtained, the local workspace is this workspace, the given incoming change sets appear among the incoming ones listed in the sync report.
        • The incoming change sets must not be active change sets.
        • The change sets can be accepted without creating gaps.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        The resulting update report contains an entry for each item (divided up by component) that has changed from its previous state in the workspace as a result of the accept operation. These entries describe what happened to the item in the workspace, and provide the information that a client would need to perform a user-directed 3-way merge and to complete the integration of the changes into the workspace. Clients should be written without making strong assumptions on exactly how a server will perform this operation; clients should instead entirely work from the information contained in the report returned on each occasion. Items that require client intervention to complete the merge are considered to be conflicted. These conflicts will be flagged in the returned update report, and will also be added to the workspace's running conflict report (conflictReport()).

        Parameters:
        flags - AcceptFlags.PREFLIGHT if this is just a trial run to find out what this operation would do, and AcceptFlags.DEFAULT if the operation should actually be carried out
        acceptSource - TODO
        syncReport - the change history sync report to use as the foundation for identifying the source workspace and for verifying the change sets to be accepted are among the incoming ones and that the change sets to preserve are among the outgoing ones; must not be null
        baselines - The baselines (one per component, element type : IBaselineHandle) to make the bases of the corresponding components in the accepting workspace; must not be null. The lack of an entry for a given component indicates that the workspace's basis for that component should remain unchanged.
        incomingChangeSets - the list of incoming change sets (element type: IChangeSetHandle) not included in the specified baselines; must not contain duplicates; must not be null; must be a subset of the incoming change sets referenced by report; change sets must be absent from any era of the underlying change history; the size of the list must not exceed IScmService.MAX_FETCHED_STATES_PER_REQUEST.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        SyncReportInappropriateException - if the operation fails because the sync report does not apply to this workspace
        GapException - if accepting the change sets would introduce a gap into change history
        ChangeSetAlreadyInHistoryException - if the change set is already in the workspace history
        ActiveChangeSetsException - if any of the given change sets is active in another workspace
        NWayConflictUnsupportedException - if the operation would produce a change-history with a conflict containing more than one proposed and one selected state.
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.7 (RTC 2.0)

      • accept

        IUpdateReport accept(int flags,
                   java.util.List incoming,
                   ITeamRepository optionalTeamRepository,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Accepts into the workspace the given incoming change sets. The incoming change sets are added to the workspace, effectively incorporating the changes they describe into the workspace configuration. The resulting update report contains an entry for each item mentioned in one of the incoming change sets not already present in the workspace. These entries describe what happened to the item in the workspace, and provide the information that a client would need to perform a user-directed 3-way merge and to complete the integration of the changes into the workspace. Clients should be written without making strong assumptions on exactly how a server will perform this operation; clients should instead entirely work from the information contained in the report returned on each occasion. Items that require client intervention to complete the merge are considered to be conflicted.

        An incoming change set is unacceptable if it affects an item in a way that cannot be squared with the change history. These "gaps" usually occur when the change history required to understand a conflict is too far in the past (in previous history rather than recent era). (One can also get gaps by attempting to accept change sets in an order contrary to their inherent dependencies). The operation fails if there would be a gap created by accepting the change. The operation is atomic; if it fails, it fails atomically.

        Parameters:
        flags - AcceptFlags.PREFLIGHT if this is just a trial run to find out what this operation would do, and AcceptFlags.DEFAULT if the operation should actually be carried out
        incoming - the list of incoming change sets (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null; change sets must be absent from any era of underlying change history; the size of the list must not exceed IScmService.MAX_FETCHED_STATES_PER_REQUEST.
        optionalTeamRepository - TODO
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        AcceptSuspendedChangeSetException - if the client sent in a suspended change set
        GapException - if accepting the change sets would introduce a gap into change history
        ChangeSetAlreadyInHistoryException - if the change set is already in the workspace history
        ActiveChangeSetsException - if any of the given change sets is active in another workspace
        NWayConflictUnsupportedException - if the operation would produce a change-history with a conflict containing more than one proposed and one selected state.
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.7 (RTC 2.0)

      • resume

        IUpdateReport resume(int flags,
                   java.util.List<IChangeSetHandle> suspended,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Resumes back into the workspace the given suspended change sets. The suspended change sets are added to the workspace, effectively incorporating the changes they describe into the workspace configuration. The resulting update report contains an entry for each item mentioned in one of the suspended change sets not already present in the workspace. These entries describe what happened to the item in the workspace, and provide the information that a client would need to perform a user-directed 3-way merge and to complete the integration of the changes into the workspace. Clients should be written without making strong assumptions on exactly how a server will perform this operation; clients should instead entirely work from the information contained in the report returned on each occasion. Items that require client intervention to complete the merge are considered to be conflicted.

        An incoming change set is unacceptable if it affects an item in a way that cannot be squared with the change history. These "gaps" usually occur when the change history required to understand a conflict is too far in the past (in previous history rather than recent era). (One can also get gaps by attempting to accept change sets in an order contrary to their inherent dependencies). The operation fails if there would be a gap created by accepting the change. The operation is atomic; if it fails, it fails atomically.

        Any specified change sets that appear in the workspace's suspended set will be removed by a successful non-preflight resume.

        Implementation note: Accepting may involve copying change sets and version states between main and local repositories; all of this is frozen material, so replication is straightforward.

        Parameters:
        flags - must be a valid bitmask value according to AcceptFlags#isValid().
        suspended - the list of suspended change sets (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null; change sets must be absent from any era of underlying change history; the size of the list must not exceed IScmService.MAX_FETCHED_STATES_PER_REQUEST.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        ActiveChangeSetsOverlapException - if an active suspended change set which overlaps another active change set in the workspace is attempted to be accepted
        ResumeNonSuspendedChangeSetException - if any of the change sets supplied are not suspended
        GapException - if accepting the change sets would introduce a gap into change history
        ChangeSetAlreadyInHistoryException - if the change set is already in the workspace history
        NWayConflictUnsupportedException - if the operation would produce a change-history with a conflict containing more than one proposed and one selected state.
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • deliver

        java.util.List<IComponentLockReport> deliver(IWorkspaceConnection remoteConnection,
                                           IChangeHistorySyncReport syncReport,
                                           java.util.List baselines,
                                           java.util.List outgoingChangeSets,
                                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Delivers from this workspace the given outgoing baseline and additional outgoing change sets.

        The basis of the target workspace or stream is replaced with the outgoing baseline (if any), and the outgoing change sets are also delivered to the target, effectively defining the configuration of the target by incorporating the changes described by both the baseline and the additional change sets. If no baseline is specified, the target basis remains unchanged, and the outgoing changes are delivered and applied to the target's existing basis.

        If a change set being delivered is active (the common case), the active change set will be closed upon successful delivery; however, if the delivery is unsuccessful, the active change set remains active (so that it remains open to further modifications to accommodate additional incoming change sets).

        The change history sync report passed in serves as the foundation for the deliver operation. The local change history of the sync report is this workspace's; the remote change history of the sync report is the target for the delivery.

        The preconditions of this operation are:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The target identified by the sync report is a workspace or stream.
        • The sync report is current; i.e., the remote workspace is unchanged since the sync report was obtained, the local workspace is this workspace, and the given baseline and change sets appear among the outgoing ones listed in the sync report.
        • The target workspace must not contain active change sets.
        • The change sets can be delivered without creating unresolved conflicts or gaps in the target workspace.
        • The components for which the change sets are siloed under do not contain any conflicts within this workspace.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        remoteConnection - the remote workspace or stream which you plan to deliver to. Cannot be null.
        syncReport - the change history sync report to use as the foundation for identifying the target workspace, and for verifying the change sets to be delivered as outgoing to that target
        baselines - The baselines (one per component, element type : IBaselineHandle) to make the bases of the corresponding components in the target workspace; must not be null. The lack of an entry for a given component indicates that the target workspace's basis for that component should remain unchanged.
        outgoingChangeSets - the list of outgoing change sets (element type: IChangeSetHandle) not included in the specified baseline; must not contain duplicates; must not be null; must be a subset of the outgoing change sets referenced by report; change sets must be absent from any era of the underlying change history; the size of the list must not exceed IScmService.MAX_FETCHED_STATES_PER_REQUEST.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        a list of locked items in the flow target which overlap the affected items in the delivery, as a reminder to the client to perhaps unlock them. Never null but perhaps empty.
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        StaleDataException - if the target workspace or stream has changed underfoot
        DeliveryIntroducesConflictsException - if delivering the change sets would create conflicts in the target workspace or stream
        SyncReportInappropriateException - if the operation fails because the sync report does not apply to this workspace
        ChangeSetsNotOutgoingException - if there are outgoing change sets which are not indicated as being outgoing in the change history sync report
        ActiveChangeSetsException - if the target workspace has active change sets
        OutstandingConflictsException - if the source workspace has outstanding conflicts which have not yet been resolved for components affected by this delivery
        GapException - if delivering the change sets would introduce a gap into change history
        ChangeSetAlreadyInHistoryException - if the change set is already in the workspace history
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        TeamOperationCanceledException - if the operation fails because of a process precondition isn't satisfied
        PermissionDeniedException - if the operation fails because the user doesn't have permissions
        DeliveryRequiresHistoryReorderingException - this exception occurs on a particular type of delivery, where the delivery fails due to DeliveryIntroducesConflictsException, but there is nothing incoming. See harmonizeHistory(IWorkspaceConnection, IComponentHandle, IProgressMonitor)
        Since:
        0.7 (RTC 2.0)

      • harmonizeHistory

        IUpdateReport harmonizeHistory(IWorkspaceConnection remoteConnection,
                             IComponentHandle componentHandle,
                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        It is possible to get into a situation where you cannot deliver because it would create conflicts in your target, but there is nothing to accept from the stream. This has to do with some of the ordering implications that change sets have. When you encounter this scenario, a call to harmonizeHistory(IWorkspaceConnection, IComponentHandle, IProgressMonitor) will restructure your change history so to produce conflicts in your workspace, that when you resolve the conflicts you will be able to deliver your previous changes + the new merges.
        Parameters:
        remoteConnection - : this is the target connection which you want to harmonize this component with. Cannot be null.
        componentHandle - : this is the component for which the user wishes to harmonize the history. Cannot be null.
        monitor -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        ConflictsProhibitOperationException - if either this or remoteConnection has conflicts for the supplied componentHandle
        TeamRepositoryException - if anything else goes wrong
        Since:
        0.8 (RTC 3.0)

      • commit

        IUpdateReport commit(IChangeSetHandle activeChangeSet,
                   java.util.Collection configOps,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Atomically adds, deletes, or changes states of versionable items in the workspace. The changes are described by configuration operation object which are created by the configuration operation factory. The order of the elements is not significant. As a side effect, the changes are accrued to the given change set, one of this workspace's active change sets. However, to see the affect on the change set, the client would need to explicitly retrieve the change set in the standard way.

        Example: 

           IFileItem newFile = …
 IFolder parentFolder = …
 IFileItemHandle obsoleteFile = …
 Collection ops = new ArrayList();
 ops.add(ws.configurationOpFactory().save(newFile));
 ops.add(ws.configurationOpFactory().save(parentFolder));
 ops.add(ws.configurationOpFactory().delete(obsoleteFile));
 IUpdateReport r = ws.commit(activeChangeSet, ops, null);

        The resulting update report contains an entry for each item mentioned in the given entries. These returned entries describe what happened to the item in the workspace. IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() will indicate whether the item was present beforehand and, if it was, what state it was in. IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() will reflect the state id of a newly-created state.

        If there is an opportunity to clean the change set up by removing a redundant change, this method tries to take advantage of the opportunity. There are circumstances that can arise in change history where this may not always be possible to do. Clients should expect that this will be the normal scenario, in that rather than producing a IChange.NONE change, we will remove the change from the change set if it keeps change history valid.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The change set is one of the workspace's active ones.
        • The same versionable item does not appear in more than one entry.
        • None of the versionable items appear in other active change sets of this workspace.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Note: This revision of commit expects a collection of configuration operations objects, whereas the previous version of this API expected a collection of versionable items.

        Parameters:
        activeChangeSet - one of the active change sets of the workspace; must not be null
        configOps - a collection of configuration operations (element type: IWorkspaceConnection.IConfigurationOp); must not contain more than one element for the same item; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        ItemAlreadyInActiveChangeSetException - if one of the items is already referenced in a different active change set other than the one specified
        PropertyConstraintException - if an item to be saved violates the constraints of its type
        DeleteSubtreeOverlapsException - if a folder specified by delete subtree overlaps with other items specified through other commit parameters, or if the descendants of this folder are referenced in other active change sets
        FolderEntryConflictException - if items have changed in a way that multiple items have the same parent and the same name
        FolderParentageCycleException - if folder parentage has changed in such a way that it would create a cycle in the configuration
        IllegalRootFolderModificationException - if the root folder would have been saved with a non-null parent or name
        NWayConflictUnsupportedException - if undoing the change would create a conflict in the workspace
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        CompletedChangeSetException - if the given change set is not active for this workspace
        ProducesOrphansInConfigurationException - if this operation would have produced an invalid configuration
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)
        See Also:
        configurationOpFactory()

      • commit

        IUpdateReport commit(java.util.List<IChangeSetHandle> activeChangeSets,
                   java.util.List<java.util.Collection<? extends IWorkspaceConnection.IConfigurationOp>> configOps,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Atomically adds, deletes, or changes states of versionable items in the workspace in multiple change sets atomically.

        The changes are described by configuration operation object which are created by the configuration operation factory. The order of the elements is not significant. As a side effect, the changes are accrued to the given change set, one of this workspace's active change sets. However, to see the affect on the change set, the client would need to explicitly retrieve the change set in the standard way.

        Example: 

           IFileItem newFile = …
 IFolder parentFolder = …
 IFileItemHandle obsoleteFile = …
 Collection ops = new ArrayList();
 ops.add(ws.configurationOpFactory().save(newFile));
 ops.add(ws.configurationOpFactory().save(parentFolder));
 ops.add(ws.configurationOpFactory().delete(obsoleteFile));
 IUpdateReport r = ws.commit(Collections.singletonList(activeChangeSet), Collections.singletonList(ops), null, null);
        The resulting update report contains an entry for each item mentioned in the given entries. These returned entries describe what happened to the item in the workspace. IItemUpdateReport.getPreviousState() will indicate whether the item was present beforehand and, if it was, what state it was in. IItemUpdateReport.getNewCurrentState() will reflect the state id of a newly-created state.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The change set is one of the workspace's active ones.
        • The same versionable item does not appear in more than one entry.
        • None of the versionable items appear in other active change sets of this workspace.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        activeChangeSets - a non-empty list of active change sets of this workspace; must not be null, contain nulls or duplicate change sets
        configOps - a non-empty list of collection of configuration operations (element type: IWorkspaceConnection.IConfigurationOp); must not contain more than one element for the same item; must not be null or contain nulls; each element in this list corresponds to the same index in the activeChangeSets list
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        ItemAlreadyInActiveChangeSetException - if one of the items is already referenced in a different active change set other than the one specified
        DeleteSubtreeOverlapsException - if a folder specified by delete subtree overlaps with other items specified through other commit operations
        FolderEntryConflictException - if items have changed in a way that multiple items have the same parent and the same name
        FolderParentageCycleException - if folder parentage has changed in such a way that it would create a cycle in the configuration
        IllegalRootFolderModificationException - if the root folder would have been saved with a non-null parent or name
        NWayConflictUnsupportedException - if undoing the change would create a conflict in the workspace
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        ProducesOrphansInConfigurationException - if this operation would have produced an invalid configuration
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)
        See Also:
        configurationOpFactory()

      • relocateChanges

        void relocateChanges(java.util.List<? extends IChangeSetHandle> targetChangeSets,
                   java.util.List<? extends IVersionableHandle> itemsToMove,
                   java.util.List<? extends IChangeSetHandle> sourceChangeSets,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Move active changes to new change sets. The list parameters for this routine serve as parallel arrays from which the server will move the active change for itemsToMove.get(i) from sourceChangeSets.get(i) to targetChangeSets.get(i), for all i. It is considered an error if the source change set does not contain a change for the item specified. It is also considered an error if the source and target change sets do not all reference the same component.
        Parameters:
        targetChangeSets - cannot be null or contain null elements, must have the same number of elements as the sourceChangeSets and itemsToMove, can contain duplicates
        itemsToMove - cannot be null or contain null or duplicate elements
        sourceChangeSets - cannot be null or contain null elements, must have the same number of elements as the sourceChangeSets and itemsToMove, can contain duplicates
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • getMostRecentBaselinesAffecting

        java.util.List<IBaseline> getMostRecentBaselinesAffecting(IComponentHandle component,
                                                        java.util.List<? extends IFolderHandle> folderHandles,
                                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the most recent baselines which affects the given list of folders. A baseline affecting a folder is described as a baseline which includes a modification to any item that is a descendant of the folder.

        The first time this method is called, the latest baseline in the workspace is returned. Subsequent calls will compute the modification baseline based on the comparison of the current state with the last compared baseline. This avoids having to compare every baseline in the change-history the first time this method is called.

        Once this method is called on a workspace, that workspace will remember the results and allow the workspace to maintain consistent responses as new baselines are delivered to it. If you create a new worksace using {@link IWorkspaceManager#copyWorkspace(com.ibm.team.repository.common.IAuditableHandle, IWorkspaceConnection, String, String, IProgressMonitor) then this metadata is also copied. If you've created a new workspace using another method, then you can call {@link #initializeMostRecentBaselinesAffecting( IComponentHandle, List, List, IProgressMonitor) to initialize the recent affecting baselines for that workspace.

        Parameters:
        workspace - the workspace whose component configurations are to be examined for the provided folders. Not null
        component - the component in this workspace whose component configurations are to be examined. Not null
        folders - the folders for which to return the recent baselines affecting them and any child element
        monitor - a repository progress monitor, or null if progress and cancellation is not required
        Returns:
        a non-null array of non-null most recent baselines affected the provided folders
        Throws:
        StaleDataException - if there is a problem writing the most recent baselines to the cache
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any reason
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection, or the component does not exist in the repository
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • initializeMostRecentBaselinesAffecting

        void initializeMostRecentBaselinesAffecting(IComponentHandle component,

      • suspend

        IUpdateReport suspend(java.util.Collection changeSets,
                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Places change sets in the contributor's suspended set. The suspended set is simply a holding bay for change sets the user wants to remember, but does not want manifest in the current configuration. Any of the specified change sets that are presently in the workspace's change history will be removed, and the workspace's configuration will be updated accordingly. As with accept and discard, suspend returns an update report which describes how the configuration of the workspace was changed by this operation.

        suspendedChangeSets() retrieves change sets in this workspace's suspended set. Use resume(int, List, IProgressMonitor)to return one or more suspended change sets to the current configuration of the workspace.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The given change sets are among this workspace's set of change sets.
          • .
        • Suspending these change sets must not make the workspace's change history invalid. When suspending change sets, there are two restrictions that must be enforced to ensure that the resulting baseline has a corresponding unambiguous configuration: (1) no included change set may build upon any discarded change set, since this would create a gap; (2) the included change sets may describe forks only if those forks are resolved by a merge change state that is also included. Both restrictions are routinely enforced on the change history of a workspace when accept operations are performed. If the workspace has a single active change set, it can be discarded without problem unless it's a merge change set.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        changeSets - the list of change sets to suspend (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the workspace has been deleted out from under the IWorkspaceConnection
        IllegalSuspendException - if the client supplies an active change set handle for a change set that is active in a different workspace than what is supplied
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • suspendedChangeSets

        java.util.List<IChangeSetHandle> suspendedChangeSets(IComponentHandle component)
        Returns the list of suspended change sets associated with a particular component for the contributor.
        Returns:
        the (possibly empty) list of suspended change sets (element type: IChangeSetHandle) for the specified component; the list is immutable; never null
        Since:

      • discardChangeSets

        IUpdateReport discardChangeSets(boolean preflight,
                              java.util.Collection changeSets,
                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Discards changes set from this flow node's change history. Discarding a change set reverts its effects on the flow node. The change sets may be either active or closed, but must be among the change sets in the recent era of this flow node's change history. The resulting update report contains an entry for each item mentioned in one of the discarded change sets. These entries describe what happened to the item in the flow object, and provide the information that a client would need to perform a user-directed 3-way merge in a workspace, and to complete the withdrawal of the changes from the flow node. Clients should be written without making strong assumptions on exactly how a server will perform this operation; clients should instead entirely work from the information contained in the report returned on each occasion.

        New in 0.81, discardChangesets will close the change sets atomic to the transaction, so the change sets can be re-accepted at a later date.

        The operation has the following preconditions:
        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • Discarding these change sets must not make the flow node's change history invalid. When discarding change sets, there are two restrictions that must be enforced to ensure that the resulting baseline has a corresponding unambiguous configuration: (1) no included change set may build upon any discarded change set, since this would create a gap; (2) the included change sets may describe forks only if those forks are resolved by a merge change state that is also included. Both restrictions are routinely enforced on the change history of a workspace when accept operations are performed. If the workspace has a single active change set, it can be discarded without problem unless it's a merge change set.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        changeSets - the list of change sets to discard (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection
        DiscardNotInHistoryException - if any of the supplied change sets are not discardable as they are not in the change history
        NWayConflictUnsupportedException - if by discarding change sets, you would be creating conflicts in the change history
        DiscardInitialBaselineException - if any of the supplied change sets are in the initial baseline
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • createBaseline

        IBaselineConnection createBaseline(IComponentHandle component,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String comment,
                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Creates a baseline of the given component known to this flow node.

        The configuration and history of the baseline is the same as the current configuration and change history of this workspace for that component.

        This component entry within this workspace will now have its basis set to the newly created baseline. If there are active change sets in this components, they will be closed as a result of this operation.

        If the component has subcomponents, a baseline hierarchy will be created, which includes baselines for all hierarchical subcomponents. If any of the subcomponents include changes in the workspace on top of the baseline, new baselines for those subcomponents will be included in the baseline hierarchy. Otherwise, existing subcomponent baselines will be included in the hierarchy. If the client needs to create baselines for multiple components, do not use this method. Instead, use IWorkspaceConnection#createMultipleBaselines(Collection, String, String, IProgressMonitor). Using the alternate method will avoid multiple calls to the server, and will avoid creating redundant baselines for components that are in the collection of components the client wants to baseline, as well as being subcomponents of other components in that collection.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The given component is known to this workspace.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        component - the component to baseline; cannot be null.
        name - the name string for the baseline; can be null in which case the baseline can still be identified by it's id.
        comment - the comment string for the baseline; can be null in which case the baseline can still be identified by it's id.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an connection to the new baseline; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection
        ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace
        ConflictsProhibitOperationException - if the workspace has conflicts for this component
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.6 (RTC 1.0)

      • createMultipleBaselines

        java.util.Collection<IBaselineConnection> createMultipleBaselines(java.util.Collection<IComponentHandle> components,
                                                                java.lang.String name,
                                                                java.lang.String comment,
                                                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Creates a collection of baselines for the given components known to this flow node.

        The configuration and history of the baselines are the same as the current configuration and change history of this workspace for each component.

        Each component entry within this workspace will now have its basis set to the newly created baseline. If there are active change sets in this components, they will be closed as a result of this operation.

        If any of the components in the collection have subcomponents, hierarchical baselines will be created for those components and their subcomponents. If a component is specified explicitly by the caller as one of the components in the collection, as well as being a subcomponent of another one of the components in the collection, then only one baseline for that component will be created.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • The given component is known to this workspace.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        components - the components to baseline; cannot be null.
        name - the name string for the baseline; can be null in which case the baseline can still be identified by it's id.
        comment - the comment string for the baseline; can be null in which case the baseline can still be identified by it's id.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection
        ComponentNotInWorkspaceException - if the operation fails because the specified component is not in the workspace
        ConflictsProhibitOperationException - if the workspace has conflicts for this component
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.11.0 (RTC 6.0)

      • createBaselineSet

        IBaselineSetHandle createBaselineSet(java.util.Collection excludedComponents,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String comment,
                                   int flags,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Creates a baseline set of the given component known to this flow node. The new baseline set is remembered in the list of this nodes known baseline set and can be found by calling IFlowNodeConnection.getBaselineSets(IProgressMonitor).

        The component entries within this workspace are not affected unless createNewBaselines is true in which case each component entry will have its basis set if a new baseline was needed for that component. If there are active change sets in the affected components, they will be closed as a result of this operation.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • There is at least one component in this stream or workspace.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        excludedComponents - the possibly-empty list of components to omit from the baseline set (element type: IComponentHandle); may be null
        name - the name string for the baseline set; cannot be null.
        comment - the comment string for the baseline; can be null.
        flags - if the BaselineSetFlags#CREATE_NEW_BASELINE flag is not set, then the most recent baseline for each component will be used for the snapshot regardless of whether the baseline includes all the changes in the component. If the flag is set, then the snapshot will contain baselines that include all the changes in the components. New baselines will be created if one does not exist. This flag should almost always be set. Not setting the flag will result in lost changes. if the BaselineSetFlags.FORCE_BASELINE_CREATION is set, a new baseline will be created for each component in the snapshot, even if a baseline that contains all the changes previously exists. If the flag is not set, existing baselines will be reused. BaselineSetFlags.FORCE_BASELINE_CREATION set implies BaselineSetFlags#CREATE_NEW_BASELINE is set
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the created baseline set; never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under the IFlowNodeConnection
        ConflictsProhibitOperationException - if the workspace has conflicts for this component
        InvalidStreamOperationException - if this connection is for a stream
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.9.0.1 (RTC 4.0.1)

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        • There is at least one component in this stream or workspace.
        The operation throws TeamRepositoryException if any of these preconditions are not met.

      • fetchFromAcceptQueue

        com.ibm.team.scm.common.IChangeSetSourcesPage fetchFromAcceptQueue(IComponentHandle component,
                                                                 long startIndex,
                                                                 int maxPageSize,
                                                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Return an IChangeSetSourcesPage containing at most maxPageSize pending accepts for a component, starting with the pending accept at startIndex. Typically this call is used to retrieve the 1st page of results. Subsequent pages should be retrieved using IWorkspaceConnection.fetchFromAcceptQueue(IPageDescriptor, IProgressMonitor) If startIndex is larger than the number of pending accepts for the receiver, an empty result is returned.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - a zero based index of the first pending accept to return. May be larger than the number of pending accepts for the component but must not be negative.
        maxPageSize - The maximum number of pending accepts to return in the result
        monintor - Monitor for progress and cancellation.
        Returns:
        an IChangeSetSourcesPage containing the results requested. The returned object will containing an IPageDescriptor which should used in calls to IWorkspaceConnection.fetchFromAcceptQueue(IPageDescriptor, IProgressMonitor) to retrieve subsequent pages of the accept queue. The IPageDescriptor has the cursor information as well as sync times to prevent iterating over a result set that has been modified. Never null.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        Since:
        0.9.0.5 (RTC 4.0.5)

      • fetchFromAcceptQueue

        com.ibm.team.scm.common.IChangeSetSourcesPage fetchFromAcceptQueue(com.ibm.team.scm.common.IPageDescriptor pageDescriptor,
                                                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Return a page of pending accepts as described by the provided pageDescriptor.
        Parameters:
        pageDescriptor - must not be null. This descriptor comes from the the IChangeSetSourcePage returned by IWorkspaceConnection.fetchFromAcceptQueue(IComponentHandle, long, int, IProgressMonitor)
        monitor - Monitor for progress and cancellation.
        Returns:
        an IChangeSetSourcesPage containing a page of results as descried by pageDescriptor. Never null.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        Since:
        0.9.0.5 (RTC 4.0.5)

      • abortCurrentPatch

        IUpdateReport abortCurrentPatch(IComponentHandle[] components,
                              int flags,
                              org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                throws TeamRepositoryException
        Aborts the current patch in progress for the component. This will discard the active change set associated with the current patch, and either remove the current patch (AcceptQueueFlags#DISCARD_CURRENT), put the current patch at the front of the accept queue (AcceptQueueFlags#REQUEUE_CURRENT) or discard the current patch and all entries from the accept queue 9AcceptQueueFlags#DISCARD_ALL).
        Parameters:
        components - The component whose current patch is to be aborted. Never null
        flags - flag that indicates the nature of the discard (see AcceptQueueFlags)
        monitor - The monitor to mark progress on.
        Returns:
        an update report of the changes to the configuration
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        Since:
        0.9.0.5 (RTC 4.0.5)
        See Also:
        AcceptQueueFlags.REQUEUE_CURRENT, AcceptQueueFlags.DISCARD_CURRENT, AcceptQueueFlags.DISCARD_ALL

                        int flags,
                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                          throws TeamRepositoryException

      • getCurrentPatchOperationFactory

        IWorkspaceConnection.ICurrentPatchOperationFactory getCurrentPatchOperationFactory()
        Returns the factory for creating current patch operations.

        Note that the factory is not specific to this repository or workspace connection; one factory is as good as any other. However, the operations are specific to the workspace from which the change details were obtained.

        Returns:
        a current patch operation factory; never null
        Since:
        0.9.0.5 (RTC 4.0.5)
        See Also:

        IUpdateReport applyCurrentPatchOperations(IComponentHandle component,
                                        java.util.List<IWorkspaceConnection.ICurrentPatchOperation> operations,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Perform the provided list of operations. Note that there can be operations for multiple versionables and multiple change details. However, if there is an operation on a versionable, there cannot be operations on the change details of that versionable.

      • reorderAcceptQueueEntries

                             UUID[] entryIds,
                             UUID afterEntry,
                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Reorder the provided entries after the afterEntry. If afterEntry is null, the provided entries will be added at the beginning of the accept queue. The provided entries must already be in the accept queue for the workspace and component for the operation to succeed.
        Parameters:
        component - the component
        entryIds - the entry to be moved
        afterEntry - the entry that the provided entries will be placed after.

      • findChangeSetsToAcceptToFillGap

        com.ibm.team.scm.common.dto.IGapFillingChangeSetsReportList findChangeSetsToAcceptToFillGap(IChangeSetHandle[] changeSetsToAccept,
                                                                                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                                            throws TeamRepositoryException
        This method is expected to be called when some change sets cannot be accepted due to gaps. In the event that the user wants to move forward, and to find a way to accept the supplied N change sets, plus others to fill the gap, this method can be called to determine that list. The idea here would be that the server (or client) could use this utility to suggest an ordered list of change sets which would apply cleanly. There may not be a history which contains all of these change sets, and thus we may not be able to provide an answer in all cases.
        Parameters:
        changeSetsToAccept - An array of the "initial" change sets to accept. Change sets can belong to different components. Cannot be null, contain null or duplicate elements or be empty.
        monitor - The given progress monitor.
        Returns:
        A report list, scoped by component, where each report contains the history-ordered list of change sets consisting of both of the "initial" change sets selected as well as the change sets which fill the gaps (but not change sets already in the repository workspace). Never null.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
        Since:
        0.10.0 (RTC 5.0)

        IUpdateReport createCurrentPatch(IComponentHandle component,

      • setCustomAttributes

        void setCustomAttributes(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attributesToAdd,
                       java.lang.String[] attributesToRemove,
                       org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                         throws TeamRepositoryException
        Modifies (adds/edits/removes) custom attributes on this stream. Note: This API can only be called if this workspace connection represents a stream. A TeamRepositoryException will be thrown if it represents a repository workspace.
        Parameters:
        attributesToAdd - The set of custom attributes to add to this stream. Note: If a custom attribute already exists it will be overwritten (i.e. it is an 'edit' in this case). Can be null as long as attributesToRemove is not null.
        attributesToRemove - The set of custom attributes to remove. Can be null as long as attributesToAdd is not null.
        monitor - A progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - If errors occur while trying to update the custom attributes.
        Since:
        0.11.0 (RTC 6.0)

      • isLocked

        boolean isLocked()
        Return true if the receiver is locked, false otherwise. This is a persistent lock to prevent intended to prevent deliver, not to be confused with transactional locks like the locks on component entries. At this time, only streams can be locked, not repository workspaces.
        Returns:
        the lock status of the receiver
        Since:
        0.11.0.2 (RTC 6.0.2)

      • isLockedByMe

At this time, only streams can be locked, not repository workspaces.
        Returns:
        the lock status of the receiver
        Since:
        0.11.0.2 (RTC 6.0.2)

      • getProcessFlowTarget

        IWorkspaceHandle getProcessFlowTarget()
        Returns the flow target to be used for process purposes for this workspace.
        Returns:
        the default outgoing flow target, default incoming flow target, current outgoing flow target or current incoming flow target, in that priority if the preceding flow target(s) isn't defined or null if no flow target is defined. Note that the flow target returned can be a stream or a repository workspace. Note: The flow target cannot be assumed to be accessible. I.e. even though the flow target resides in a repository workspace's flow table, the flow target may have been deleted from the repository or the user may no longer have read-access to it. This means that callers of this method that attempt to fetch the flow target should be prepared to handle ItemNotFoundException and PermissionDeniedException.
        Since:
        0.11.0.2 (RTC 6.0.2)

      • fetchAcceptCombinedUpdateReport

        IAcceptCombinedUpdateReport fetchAcceptCombinedUpdateReport(IWorkspaceConnection otherConnection,
                                                          int flags,
                                                          java.util.List<? extends IComponentHandle> componentsToConsider,
                                                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                            throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns an update report which represents the delta between the current workspace's configuration and the supplied other flow node's configurations. This operation is read-only and does not alter the workspace in any way.
        Parameters:
        otherConnection - the other flow node connection, cannot be null
        flags - a bitmask of the different values defined in WorkspaceComparisonFlags for WorkspaceComparisonFlags.CHANGE_SET_COMPARISON_ONLY, the returned report contains only the lists of incoming and outgoing change sets; for WorkspaceComparisonFlags.INCLUDE_BASELINE_INFO, the returned report additional contains the lists of incoming and outgoing baselines and the lists of just the incoming and outgoing change sets that are after the last incoming or outgoing baseline. if the mask includes WorkspaceComparisonFlags.INCLUDE_EMPTY_BASELINES, then the compare report will include baselines which are empty wrt their predecessor as well as baselines for which there are no incoming or outgoing changes corresponding for. if the mask includes WorkspaceComparisonFlags.INCLUDE_REPLACED_COMPONENT_INFO, then the compare report will include information on components that were replaced in remoteFlowNode.
        componentsToConsider - the client can supply null to indicate that they want to compare all components common to both workspaces, or a non-empty list of components to consider (the list cannot contain nulls.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an update report, never null
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the flow node has been deleted out from under either IWorkspaceConnection
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        Since:
        0.11.0.2 (RTC 6.0.2)
